Thymus albicans belongs to Sect. Mastichina, together with Thymus mastichina (L.) L . subsp. mastichina and Thymus mastichina subsp. donyanae R. Morales
10 . The aerial flowering parts of the plant are traditionally used for the same purposes of T. mastichina subsp. mastichina, mainly for the treatment of oral and pharyngeal inflammation and dermatitis
11 . Additionally, there is ethnopharmacological evidence of its use as a stomach tonic in Spain
